definition: to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: So can all sink not to live to exasperate for several annuals, those small youth men, .
sentences.chinese: 这么多年，那些小后生们，可都沉不住气了。

sentences.english: I said that a little too loudly, didn't I?
sentences.chinese: 大惊小怪的啊，一点也沉不住气。

sentences.english: The more letters Shen wrote, the less patience he had.
sentences.chinese: 信越写越多，沈从文也越发的沉不住气。

sentences.english: Don't get excited the moment you hear a criticism.
sentences.chinese: 不要一听到批评就沉不住气。

definition: to stay calm/to keep one's composure
to fret/to get impatient/to become anxious
to be unable to hold back
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
